results.title: Royal Scotland
results.brief_description: The last film made by the Crown Film Unit. The scenic beauty of Scotland and its many royal and historic associations. The film shows the Royal Family at Balmoral and at the Highland Games at Braemar and includes glimpses of ancient castles and abbeys, of golf at St Andrews and of massed pipers in Princes Street, Edinburgh.

results.title: Royal river [Abridged version]
results.creator_credit: Grant McLean, ONF | NFB, Gordon Sparling and Roger Blais
results.brief_description: The picturesque St. Lawrence, Canada’s river of history, welcomes Queen Elizabeth II to the opening of the St. Lawrence Seaway. Many close-ups of the Queen, Prince Philip and President Eisenhower are shown. The theme of the film is the river’s history, from its discovery by French explorers to its opening to the shipping of the world. This is an abridged version.

results.title: Royal review 1962
results.brief_description: Covers many colorful occasions in the Royal calendar for 1962, including the Trooping the Color Ceremony, the 16th Royal Film Performance, Independence celebrations in Jamaica, Trinidad and Uganda, the Chelsea Flower Show, the opening of the new Commonwealth Institute in London and HRH the Duke of Edinburgh’s tour of South America.

results.title: Royal parade
results.brief_description: The newly formed Royal Western Australian REgiment receives its new colors. Field-Marshal the Prince Philip, Duke of Edinburgh, is present at the colorful ceremony during which the old colors are tropped through the ranks. The new colors are blessed and consecrated by the chaplains. His Highness presents the new Queen’s colors and new regimental colors then addresses all ranks. Finally the new regiment advances in review order and His Highness takes a General Salute.

results.title: Royal Military College
results.brief_description: On the site of a former sheep station now stands one of Australia’s most modern military colleges. Prospective cadets are expected to have had a sound secondary education, as the four year course is of University standard, and covers Engineering, Science or Arts and the theory and practice of modern warfare. Field exercises are part of the plan to develop initiative and leadership and back in the laboratories experiments are carried out on rocket propellents and explosives. Facilities for recreation are many and varied, and include a ski lodge and a fully equipped gymnasium.
